ai.summary: Bentham Heritage Trail B is an 11.1-kilometer moderate hike in the United Kingdom. This route combines rural scenery with historic sites and village character, making it suitable for walkers who enjoy cultural landscapes and steady pacing.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail follows a mix of rural lanes, field paths, and short sections of minor roads. Expect uneven surfaces, grassy verges, and potential mud in wet weather; some gentle elevation changes may test pace.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather forecasts before you go—UK weather can change rapidly. Wear sturdy, waterproof hiking boots and bring a rain jacket. Carry enough water, snacks, a map or GPS, and a fully charged phone. Tell someone your plan and be prepared for farm animals or quiet road sections. Stay on public rights of way and respect local property.
recommended_gear: Hat and sunscreen for sun exposure
Headlamp or flashlight (for shorter days or delays)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn offer the best conditions for this moderate trail, with milder weather and clearer scenery; the hike can be done year-round with extra precautions for winter conditions.

seo.title: Bentham Heritage Trail B – 11.1 km Moderate Hike in the United Kingdom
seo.meta_description: Explore Bentham Heritage Trail B, an 11.1 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom. Enjoy countryside, historic sites, and village charm with practical hiking tips and gear recommendations.
